channel.title: accessatlanta.com - Entertainment
channel.description: Latest articles for the Entertainment section at accessatlanta.com.

item.title: TCM's Oscar special appeals to viewers' trivial pursuits
item.description: TCM's Robert Osborne will prep movie fans during “31 Days of Oscar,” which this year focuses on Oscar trivia.
item.author: mruggieri@ajc.com
item.dc:creator: Melissa Ruggieri

item.title: ‘America's Got Talent' searches Atlanta for contenders
item.description: NBC’s “America’s Got Talent” casting call in Atlanta drew thousands of would-be contestants.
item.author: rho@ajc.com
item.dc:creator: Rodney Ho

item.title: Jimmy Buffett knocked unconscious in concert fall
item.description: Jimmy Buffett fell off the stage and was knocked unconscious during his concert finale in Sydney, Australia, on Wednesday, TMZ.com is reporting.
item.author: lhartstein@ajc.com
item.dc:creator: Larry Hartstein

item.title: Revised ‘Idol’ ready for debut
item.description: “American Idol” executives knew Season 9 was a major disappointment. The chemistry among the judges was poor.
item.author: rho@ajc.com
item.dc:creator: Rodney Ho

item.title: Marietta woman competes for Miss America crown
item.description: A Miss Georgia hasn’t claimed the Miss America crown since Neva Jane Langley of Macon won it in 1953.
item.dc:creator: Tucker McQueen

item.title: HGTV's Vern Yip designs with kids in mind
item.description: Before the arrival of his son, everyone told HGTV design guru Vern Yip that his house would look totally different.
item.author: nrhone@ajc.com
item.dc:creator: Nedra Rhone

item.title: Pet owners choosing more human names
item.description: When it comes to naming pets, ‘tween girls apparently retain veto power. For the second year in a row, "Bella" was 2010's most popular name for pooches and surged to second-most popular with feline fans, according to a review of 485,000 animal sobriquets by the Veterinary Pet Insurance Company.
item.author: cboone@ajc.com
item.dc:creator: Christian Boone

item.title: Second teen charged in Tyler Perry break-in
item.description: A second teen has been charged with breaking into Tyler Perry's Paces Ferry Road mansion, police said.
item.author: cboone@ajc.com
item.dc:creator: Christian Boone

item.title: Teenager charged with breaking into Tyler Perry's house
item.description: An early-morning intruder was captured within moments after breaking into the Paces Ferry Road home of actor and producer Tyler Perry, Atlanta police confirmed Monday.
item.author: rcook@ajc.com
item.dc:creator: Rhonda Cook

item.title: Steve Harvey cranks out another relationship book
item.description: With his track record of two divorces and a third marriage, comedian, radio host and actor Steve Harvey is not the most obvious person to become a relationships guru.
item.author: rho@ajc.com
item.dc:creator: Rodney Ho

item.title: Tyler Perry offers to rebuild burned home
item.description: Atlanta TV and movie mogul Tyler Perry has offered to rebuild the home of a great-grandmother who lost everything in a fire, according to an article on wsbtv.com .
item.dc:creator: Staff reports

item.title: After long tenure, Pruitt prepares for final newscast
item.description: After 46 years in the business, John Pruitt will anchor his last news broadcast Friday. He still remembers his first story.
item.author: bemerson@ajc.com
item.dc:creator: Bo Emerson

item.title: Newton delivers Letterman ‘Top Ten' list
item.description: The media blitz continues for Heisman Trophy winner Cam Newton. The Auburn star and Westlake High graduate delivered the famous "Top Ten" list on Monday night's "Late Show with David Letterman." Even the famous trophy was there.
item.author: apstevens@ajc.com
item.dc:creator: Alexis Stevens

item.title: 'Extreme Makover' costs Savannah $26,000
item.description: The city of Savannah provided almost $26,000 in taxpayer funded services to the recent production of the ABC television show "Extreme Makeover." The Savannah Morning News reports that an open records search shows city government donated that much in waived fees and services to the effort to demolish and rebuild a home for a family chosen by the show's producers.

item.title: Report: Katt Williams must pay almost $578K over dog attack
item.description: Comedian Katt Williams has been ordered to pay $577,929 to an Atlanta record producer over a dog attack during a debt dispute, according to a report on tmz.com .
item.dc:creator: Staff reports

item.title: Leslie Nielsen’s life celebrated at open-casket cocktail party
item.description: As the jazzy soundtrack of The Naked Gun blared on the speakers and Canadian mounties saluted, actor Leslie Nielsen’s coffin was carried into Fort Lauderdale’s Lago Mar Resort Monday afternoon for a memorial billed as “Cocktails With Leslie and Barbaree.”
item.dc:creator: Jose Lambiet

item.title: Busy Kenny Leon will direct Halle Berry in MLK drama
item.description: Ever-busy Atlanta director Kenny Leon will direct Halle Berry in her Broadway debut, along with Samuel L.
item.author: hpousner@ajc.com
item.dc:creator: Howard Pousner

item.title: Korea-born Gyun Hur, 27, wins $50,000 Hudgens Prize
item.description: Gyun Hur, a 27-year-old Marietta resident who came to the U.S. from her native Korea at age 13, has won the first Hudgens Prize, a visual arts competition with an award of $50,000.
item.author: hpousner@ajc.com
item.dc:creator: Howard Pousner

item.title: Adam West, Burt Ward at Atlanta Comic Con
item.description: Once upon a time, before he discovered there was a career in making fun of himself, Adam West resented the stranglehold that "Batman" had on his career.
item.author: bemerson@ajc.com
item.dc:creator: Bo Emerson

item.title: T.I. 'sick and ... tired' of being in prison
item.description: Atlanta-based rapper talks about his regrets over his actions in a statement posted on his website.
item.dc:creator: Staff reports
